intro: Ortholoma pendulum, commonly known as the hanging ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a fern-like appearance. Ortholoma pendulum thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
